items.title: Viral apple cider vinegar weight loss study retracted for flawed science
bullets: • BMJ Group has retracted research suggesting that small daily quantities of apple cider vinegar might help people who are overweight or obese to lose weight
• The small clinical trial was published in the open access journal BMJ Nutrition, Prevention & Health in March 2024 and its findings press released

items.title: TVC15: Darth Vader (VC08)
bullets: • The only reason you would want to add this figure to your collection is for nostalgia
• Hasbro got a lot of mileage out of this Darth Vader action figure
• By today's standards, it’s obsolete, but it served a grand purpose for decades

items.title: National Parks Are Staying Open During the Government Shutdown, Putting Visitors and Resources at Risk
bullets: • The U.S
• government officially shut down at midnight Wednesday after a deadlock between President Donald Trump and Congress over spending
• 12,000 National Park Service employees were furloughed, including 3,000 employees to run the country’s 433 sites maintained by the agency
• Advocates fear the situation may be worse because it comes after the Trump administration slashed staff

items.title: Horror Highlights: FEARFEST, BLACK PHONE 2, HAZBIN HOTEL, Mad Cave Studios
bullets: • AMC Networks Unveils official trailer for “FearFest” with HalloQueen Janelle Monáe
• Key sponsors are on board for the long-running, annual horror and genre programming event
• BACARDÍ Rum and Kraft Heinz are presenting sponsors

items.title: Violence breaks out in Morocco as anti-government protests rage for fourth day
bullets: • Anti-government demonstrations gripped Morocco for the fourth night in a row as young people filled the streets of cities and destruction and violence broke out in several places
• The “Gen Z” demonstrations mirror similar unrest sweeping countries such as Nepal and Madagascar
• Dozens of peaceful protesters were arrested over the weekend

items.title: Matt Wagner talks Dracula Book III: The Count
bullets: • Matt Wagner (Grendel) and Kelley Jones (Batman: Red Rain) are returning to their fresh take on Bram Stoker’s 1897 novel Dracula with a new chapter
• The Count continues their re-telling from the point-of-view of Dracula himself and moves further along in the story in graphic novel form

items.title: US national parks to remain partly open during government shutdown
bullets: • Parts of the US government shutdown will remain open to the public
• More than 9,200 employees will be furloughed, reducing staff by 64%
• Only workers deemed necessary to protect ‘life and property’ will be on duty

items.title: “The Story of a Devil, Straight from the Devil’s Own Mouth” — Q&A: Matt Wagner and Kelley Jones Discuss Their New Graphic Novel DRACULA: BOOK III—THE COUNT, Now on Kickstarter!
bullets: • Matt Wagner and Kelley Jones have fleshed out Bram Stoker's classic novel like never before
• Dracula: Book III—The Count is now on Kickstarter
• Daily Dead caught up with Matt and Kelley in a new Q&A feature to discuss their latest collaboration

items.title: Fantastic Fest 2025 Review: MEAT KILLS Leans Into Aughts Horror with Mixed Results
bullets: • Meat Kills was playing at Fantastic Fest in New York
• The film is heavily inspired by a number of recent horror films
• Similarities to The Texas Chainsaw Massacre and High Tension (1974) have been noted in the film
• There is a lot of blue and yellow color grading similar to the films of that period

items.title: Found Footage Horror ‘Project Butterfly: Flatwoods’ Coming Halloween Night 2025!
bullets: • Project Butterfly: Flatwoods is a found footage horror film set during the lunar eclipse of 2004, in Flatwoods, West Virginia
• The film follows three students who are filming a school project centered around an investigation that eventually leads them to a government bunker connected to cryptid experimentation
• The further the students dig, the more they uncover the terrifying truths of this bunker

items.title: Border wall slicing through Arizona wildlife corridor begins construction: ‘A show of force for nothing’
bullets: • The San Rafael Valley, south-east of Tucson, is considered one of the most biodiverse regions in North America
• But in recent days, a towering black steel wall has begun to rise on the landscape
• Trump administration is forging ahead with plans to erect a 27-mile section of the border wall here

items.title: This ultra-thin solar tech could power everything from phones to skyscrapers
bullets: • Researchers at Chalmers University of Technology in Sweden unraveled the structure of a promising solar material using machine learning and advanced simulations
• Their findings could unlock durable, ultra-efficient solar cells for a rapidly electrifying world
• Solar cells could be so thin and flexible that they could encase anything from mobile phones to skyscrapers

items.title: Before they sucked blood, leeches were ocean hunters
bullets: • A 430-million-year-old fossil reveals leeches began as ocean hunters long before they evolved into bloodsuckers
• Unlike today’s bloodsucking leeches, their ancient ancestors likely hunted small marine animals using a tail sucker rather than piercing skin

items.title: Swiping less, living more. How to take control of your digital life
bullets: • In an always-on world, our phones have become lifelines – but at what cost? In Smartphone Nation, digital ‘nutritionist’ Kaitlyn Regehr explores our tangled relationship with screens
• She makes a case for reclaiming control through honesty, intention and digital literacy

items.title: ‘Dominant on the river’: 32 Chunk crowned champion in ‘biggest Fat Bear Week yet’
bullets: • 32 Chunk wins 'biggest Fat Bear Week' after record-breaking week of public voting
• Annual competition pits different wild bears against each other based on before-and-after photos of the bears’ weight gain as they prepare for winter
• Chunk dethroned 128 Grazer, the female bear who has held the title for the past two years

items.title: TVC15: Weequay (VC107)
bullets: • Weequay might have been the biggest surprise in the final wave of the initial run of The Vintage Collection
• Hasbro had shied away from updates for years, as the 1997 version held up so well
• This figure iteration still holds up well, and we hope that Hasbro makes the rest of them from the film

items.title: Former DRC president Joseph Kabila sentenced to death in absentia
bullets: • A court in the Democratic Republic of the Congo has sentenced the former president to death in absentia
• The case stems from his alleged role in backing the advance of M23 rebels in DRC’s eastern provinces
• He was also ordered to pay about $50bn in damages to the state and victims

items.title: US energy department cracks down on workers’ use of climate crisis language
bullets: • The US Department of Energy has told employees in the Office of Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy (EERE) to avoid using the words ‘climate change’ and ‘decarbonization’ in an email from an agency acting director seen by the Guardian
• Also on the list are ‘energy transition’, ‘clean’ or ‘dirty’ energy” and “carbon/CO2 ‘footprint’”

items.title: RFR Q&A #267: Star Wars Inspired Nachos
items.outlet: All Shows - Rebel Force Radio: Star Wars Podcast
bullets: • RFR Q&A #267: Star Wars Inspired Nachos
• Plus, we discuss RFR at Rancho Obi-Wan, LEGO Star Wars: Rebuild The Galaxy
• Joe Dallas was gifted an odd-ball piece of Star Wars bootleg memorabilia

items.title: New Star Wars: Starfighter Rumors
bullets: • Starfighter has entered production, but some rumors are beginning to spread
• Ryan Gosling, who is NOT a Jedi, is asked by Amy Adams’ character to escort her young son to safety, namely, to bring him to Rey
• The plot leak we got is, as usual, unconfirmed, so all the usual caveats apply

items.title: Rejoice: Netflix Just Added ’28 Days Later,’ the Best Zombie Movie Ever Made
bullets: • "28 Years Later" is the best zombie movie of the year, horror or otherwise
• The underlying theme among these all, as violent and dour as their narratives are, is hope
• The movie is a sequel to 2002's "28 Days Later"

items.title: New Funko Pop!s Include ‘Pumpkinhead,’ ‘Predator: Badlands,’ ‘Godzilla,’ ‘Stranger Things,’ More
bullets: • New Funko Pop!s include ‘Pumpkinhead, ‘Predator: Badlands,’ ‘Godzilla’ and ‘Stranger Things’ Standard Pop! figures start at $14.99

items.title: ‘Camp’ Review: Melancholy Magical Perfection from Avalon Fast [Fantastic Fest 2025]
bullets: • Avalon Fast's sophomore feature, CAMP, had its world premiere at Fantastic Fest 2025
• The film stars Zola Grimmer, who plays Emily, who is haunted by a series of tragic deaths
• Fast's film is about floating through the mires of grief and what it means to bond with those who seem to understand you

items.title: Trump says drug cartels operating in the Caribbean are ‘unlawful combatants’
bullets: • The US military conducted strikes on three boats in the Caribbean Sea last month that killed 17 people
• The administration is required by law to report to Congress the US government’s use of armed forces
• The memo reportedly states that the US is now in a “non-international armed conflict”

items.title: Energy Dept. axes hundreds of 'green' projects in 'blue states' during shutdown
bullets: • The Energy Department rescinded more than 300 awards to projects in 16 states won by Kamala Harris in the 2024 presidential election
• The rescissions of nearly $8 billion in funding were announced on Wednesday, the first day of the federal government shutdown
• Some of the cancellations were previously announced in May

items.title: ‘A Quiet Place Part III’ Moves into New Summer 2027 Release Date
bullets: • A Quiet Place Part III will now go wide on July 30, 2027, the studio announced today
• The new film will be directed, written, and produced by returning filmmaker John Krasinski
• The most recent installment in the franchise was last year’s spinoff movie A Quiet place: Day One

items.title: US government shutdown: Donald Trump promises firings and cuts to ‘Democrats’ favorite projects’ if shutdown continues – live
bullets: • Trump promises firings, cuts to Democrats' 'favorite projects' if shutdown continues
• 'There could be firings and that's their fault, and that’s their fault,' he said of Democrats in Congress
• Trump said he had 'big plans' for the 2026 midterm elections

items.title: ‘Monster High’ Sees Double with Jordan Peele’s ‘Us’ Adelaide and Red Skullector Dolls
bullets: • Mattel and Monster High are seeing double for the latest Skullector doll release
• Adelaide and her doppelganger Red from Jordan Peele’s Us will be available on October 6, 2025, at 9am PT only on MattelCreations.com

items.title: Before ‘Monster: The Ed Gein Story,’ Stream This Underrated Gein-Inspired 70s Shocker
bullets: • Ed Gein is viewed by many true crime fanatics as the first serial killer of the modern era
• The Monster series is the latest true crime Netflix series from Ryan Murphy
• In fact, if you're looking for more Gein-inspired terror, you should seek out a 50-year-old cult classic based on his crimes

items.title: The Ultimate Monster Mash Is Happening This October on Prime Video
bullets: • The Ultimate Monster Mash is happening this October on Prime Video
• Prime Video has added a handful of classic horror films to its streaming service
• The movies include Dracula, Frankenstein, Bride of Frankenstein, The Invisible Man, Creature from the Black Lagoon and The Wolf Man

items.title: In Its New Carbon Plan, Duke Energy Gambles on Coal as a Shorter-Term Fix for Powering Data Centers
bullets: • Duke Energy plans to burn coal for two to four years longer than previously estimated
• The move will result in millions of tons in additional greenhouse gases over the next decade
• Duke cited the state’s growing energy demand, driven by data centers and large manufacturers, as reasons for the changes

items.title: Trump touts shutdown as 'unprecedented opportunity' to cut more Democratic priorities
bullets: • President Donald Trump says Democrats have given him an "unprecedented opportunity" to slash federal agencies
• He says he will meet with Sen
• Chuck Schumer and Rep
• Hakeem Jeffries to decide what to do with the government shutdown
• The White House has already cut $18 billion for two major projects in New York City and $8 billion for climate-related projects

items.title: Trailer for Biblical Horror Film Starring Nic Cage Sparks Outrage: “Playing with God like that is not to be taken lightly”
bullets: • The Carpenter’s Son is based on the Infancy Gospel of Thomas
• The film stars Nicolas Cage as Jesus' father, Joseph, and FKA twigs as Joseph's wife, Mary
• Conservative Christians are up in arms over the idea of a film depicting a teenage Jesus tempted by a playmate

items.title: ‘Scurry’ Review – A Spider Creature Feature Hampered by its One-Shot Gimmick
bullets: • Australian filmmaker Luke Sparke has created an ambitious creature feature called Scurry
• The film follows a man trapped in a series of tunnels underneath a city undergoing a giant monst
• Scurry was completed before Primitive War, with its wide release having been held back until the film's release was released

items.title: Treasure hunters discover $1m in silver and gold coins off Florida coast
bullets: • More than 1,000 silver and gold coins were found in the wreckage of 1715
• They are thought to be worth more than $1 million
• The coins are believed to be the remains of the Spanish Empire
• They were discovered in the aftermath of a hurricane in which they were found

items.title: Why iRobot’s founder won’t go within 10 feet of today’s walking robots
bullets: • MIT professor emeritus Rodney Brooks says walkers are unsafe for humans to be near to walk robots

• Brooks: "We will not see humanoid robots get certified to be deployed in zones that also have people in them" He says companies pouring billions into humanoid development are chasing an expensive fantasy

items.title: ‘Dangerous Animals’ Swims Onto Steelbook 4K UHD Next Week
bullets: • 'Dangerous Animals' will be released on SteelBook 4K UHD + Blu-ray on October 7 via IFC
• The Australian serial killer/shark horror hybrid is directed by Sean Byrne and written by Nick Lepard
• No special features are listed, but a “Tucker's Experience’ vinyl sticker is included

items.title: Betty and Veronica Meet a Monster in Complete Classic Story from ARCHIE COMICS DIGEST: HALLOWEEN SPECIAL
bullets: • Archie Comics Digest: Halloween Special is now available in comic book shops and bookstores
• As a special exclusive treat just for Daily Dead readers, we have a complete classic story from the digest that you can enjoy right now! You can read "The Failure" in its entirety below

items.title: Elon Musk is telling his followers to cancel Netflix subscriptions. Here's what's happening
bullets: • Elon Musk calls for cancellation of "Dead End: Paranormal Park" The show was canceled after two seasons
• The show's creator says the show was mocking the death of a character
• Netflix has more than 300,000 subscribers in the next year

items.title: RFK Jr. drags feet on COVID-19 vaccine recommendations, delaying shots for kids
bullets: • No federal health official has signed off on recommendations for this year's updated COVID-19 vaccines
• This leaves the federal vaccination schedule without an update and access to the shots in limbo for some low-income children
• The CDC is currently without a director to sign off on ACIP recommendations

items.title: Intel stock is up 50% over the last month, putting U.S. stake at $16 billion
bullets: • Shares of U.S
• chipmaker Intel climbed 3% Thursday, putting the monthly gain over 50%
• The surge pushed the stock past $37, hiking the value of the government's 10% stake in Intel to roughly $16 billion
• The Trump administration negotiated an $8.9 billion investment in Intel common stock in August

items.title: Federal agencies blaming Democrats for shutdown in potentially illegal move
bullets: • Furloughed federal employees at some agencies have been instructed to set out-of-office messages explaining that they are not working because Democrats caused a shutdown
• The political messaging may be a violation of the Hatch Act, which prohibits federal employees from engaging in partisan political activity

items.title: EPA Moves to Prioritize Review of New Chemicals for Data Centers
bullets: • The EPA is prioritizing the review of potentially hazardous chemicals used in data centers
• Public health advocates and environmental attorneys warn the chemicals could endanger workers, communities and the environment
• The EPA’s language is “hugely broad” and “shocking,” a chemical policy director with the Environmental Defense Fund says

items.title: Strange Harvest | Disturbing and unnerving faux true-crime docu-horror set for digital release
bullets: • The film is set to be released in the UK from 27th October
• It is the first time the film has been released in over two decades
• The film will be available on iTunes and Amazon.com.com for the rest of the year

items.title: The 36 Best Movies on HBO Max Right Now (October 2025)
bullets: • New Zealand's Jacinda Ardern is one of very few heads of state in history to give birth while still in office
• The documentary chronicles her meteoric rise, resignation, and life after being prime minister
• A24's partnership with HBO continues to ensure that a never-ending stream of fascinating new indies find their way into the Max library

items.title: Travel, national parks and housing: what does the US government shutdown mean for everyday people?
bullets: • Federal employees who are furloughed or required to work without pay will receive back pay
• The EPA was expected to be hit hardest, with 89% of its staff furloughed
• The US Postal Service is an independent service that relies on revenue from its products and services, not tax dollars

items.title: Evil Dead in Concert Hits Los Angeles with Immersive Underground Horror Experience
bullets: • An exclusive three-night Halloween weekend engagement October 30 – November 1 at the historic Million Dollar Theatre
• Tickets are on sale now and available at www.streetfoodcinema.com
• The Cellar: An Underground Evil Dead Experience — a first-of-its-kind immersive horror attraction featuring experience designs and original props by Burbank's acclaimed Mystic Museum

items.title: As the shutdown drags on, the threat of permanent cuts is mired in politics
bullets: • President Trump says he will meet with his budget director about which agencies to cut
• The White House is using the shutdown to take aim at the Democratic Party
• The budget director has also warned that layoffs of federal workers would begin within days
• Some call the threats a political "bluff" to force Democrats to come back to the table

items.title: Bloodspawn arrives on The B Stream
bullets: • The outrageous monster movie throwback, “Bloodspawn” kicks off 31 Days of Halloween on The B Stream
• Bill Oberst Jr
• (Abraham Lincoln Vs
• Zombies), R
• Keith Harris (The Walking Dead), Roger Willie (Windtalkers), and Raw Lieba (Bone Tomahawk) assemble in this all out horror romp

items.title: Awesome Games Studio summons HELLREAPER. Check the very first trailer!
bullets: • Awesome Games Studio, the team behind the hit title Yet Another Zombie Survivors, is revealing their newest project: HELLREAPER
• The game is still in development, but you can already wishlist it on Steam, Xbox, and PlayStation

items.title: Israel intercepts Gaza flotilla and detains activists including Greta Thunberg
bullets: • Israel intercepts Gaza flotilla and detains activists including Greta Thunberg
• Global Sumud Flotilla (GSF) was carrying aid bound for Gaza
• Israel said its navy told the boats to change course as they were "approaching an active combat zone"

items.title: Our Favorite All-in-One Printer and Scanner Is $50 Off
bullets: • The Epson EcoTank ET-2980 is marked down by $50 on Amazon
• It has all the features most home users will need, even daily printers
• It was surprisingly easy to set up, with ink bottles that don't drip or leave stains

items.title: Government Workers Say Their Out-of-Office Replies Were Forcibly Changed to Blame Democrats for Shutdown
bullets: • Department of Education employees set their automatic out-of-office email responses to inform recipients that they would be unable to respond until after the shutdown
• The automatic reply now blamed Senate Democrats for the entire shutdown
• It’s not clear who made the change to email accounts, which was first posted about on Bluesky

items.title: Trump offers universities a choice: Comply for preferential funding
bullets: • The Wall Street Journal has published a proposal for colleges and universities to sign up to the deal
• Failure to accept the deal would see the government dictate everything from hiring and admissions standards to grading
• The deal would include federal grants and other benefits to the universities

items.title: Meta won’t allow users to opt out of targeted ads based on AI chats
bullets: • Users will have to click through to see that their interactions with AI will be personalized
• The changes will be implemented on October 7
• Users will be able to opt out of the changes, which are not immediately available to all users
• Facebook, Instagram and Twitter users will also be affected by the changes

items.title: 5 Questions With Artist Kelley Jones About Dracula Book 3: The Count
bullets: • Matt Wagner and Kelley Jones have created a graphic novel series based on the famous Transylvanian nobleman
• A Kickstarter is now underway for the new volume in the series
• It continues a re-telling of the story from the point-of-view of the Count

items.title: World-famous primatologist Jane Goodall dead at 91
bullets: • Jane Goodall died of natural causes while in California as part of a US speaking tour
• Her field research in the 1960s essentially redefined the relationship between humans and animals
• Goodall was passionate about empowering young people to become involved in conservation

items.title: First killings in Morocco since Gen Z protests erupted
bullets: • First deaths in Morocco since huge youth-led protests broke out on Saturday
• Police say they were forced to open fire to prevent protesters from storming a police station
• One protester said the hospital where he was being held was like a "jail"

items.title: Pope Leo's religious community is drawing renewed interest. Here's what makes it unique
bullets: • James Schloegel is one of three men who formally entered the U.S
• province of the Order of St
• Augustin, known as the Augustinians
• He is part of a noticeable uptick in interest in the small Roman Catholic religious order

items.title: House Minority Leader Jeffries defends Democrats' healthcare push amid shutdown
bullets: • NPR's Scott Detrow talks with House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries on his Democratic Party's strategy to resolve the government shutdown
• Jeffries defends Democrats' healthcare push amid shutdown
• Hear on All Things Considered on October 2, 20254:26 PM ET

items.title: National Guard presence may deter crime, but experts warn of the long-term costs
bullets: • National Guard presence may deter crime, but experts warn of the long-term costs
• Some research suggests their visible presence could make a difference
• The Guard's military identity, coupled with their presence in cities that did not request them, could generate resentment

items.title: Israel intercepts aid flotilla headed for Gaza
bullets: • Israel intercepts aid flotilla headed for Gaza October 2, 20254:24 PM ET Heard on All Things Considered Ruth Sherlock Israel
• As Israel intercepted the aid ships, an airstrike also killed at least one aid worker in Gaza

items.title: Disney's image tanks among Republicans, Democrats after Jimmy Kimmel controversy
bullets: • Sentiment for Disney and its streaming service plunged to multiyear lows after Jimmy Kimmel's show was pulled off air
• Disney became a cultural flashpoint after taking Kimmel's late-night comedy show briefly off the air in the wake of his comments about slain conservative activist Charlie Kirk

items.title: Scaffolding collapsed as people climbed to see Ethiopia church mural, eyewitness tells BBC
bullets: • Scaffolding collapsed as people climbed to see Ethiopia church mural, eyewitness tells BBC
• Mass funerals were held in the small Ethiopian town of Arerti for the 36 people killed
• Hundreds of mourners walked with coffins draped in colourful cloth into the compound of a nearby church

items.title: Horror Highlights: FRANKENSTEIN, WE BURY THE DEAD, TELLURIDE HORROR SHOW
bullets: • Guillermo del Toro's FRANKENSTEIN: Halloween IMAX Screening Announced, Tickets now available
• The Halloween special screening of Frankenstein in Hollywood will be held in IMAX on Halloween
• The 16th annual Telluride Horror Show will return to Colorado for a three-day horror film festival

items.title: China Rolls Out Its First Talent Visa as the US Retreats on H-1Bs
bullets: • China has launched a new visa program designed to make it easier for young professionals and people with degrees in science and technology to study and do business in the country
• The program was introduced just weeks after the Trump administration announced a new $100,000 fee for H-1B visas

items.title: AI designs for dangerous DNA can slip past biosecurity measures, study shows
bullets: • AI designs for dangerous DNA can slip past biosecurity measures, study shows
• Biotech companies have protections in place to keep dangerous biological material out of the hands of would-be evil-doers
• Researchers found that protein-design tools could be used to "paraphrase" DNA codes of toxic proteins

items.title: Kenyan activists abducted after joining opposition rally in Uganda
bullets: • Two men were arrested in Uganda on suspicion of corruption
• The two men are believed to have been involved in the country’s ongoing political crisis
• The men were allegedly involved in a fight against the government of Uganda's president
• They were arrested by police and taken to their homes in Uganda by helicopter

items.title: Former Google CEO Will Fund Boat Drones to Explore Rough Antarctic Waters
bullets: • The Southern Ocean is the world's largest carbon sink
• It absorbs about a third of the CO2 humans put into the atmosphere each year
• The project is part of a $45 million fund created by Eric Schmidt and his wife Wendy
• It will use drones to collect data from the ocean around Antarctica

items.title: Vehicle-to-Grid Power Is Becoming a Reality, But Why Isn’t Progress Faster?
bullets: • A Maryland utility is touting a project that allows owners of Ford F-150 Lightning electric pickups to send power from their vehicles to the grid
• The project is a partnership with Ford, the automaker, and Sunrun, a solar and energy services company
• But the nagging sense I get when reading about pilot projects is that this is an opportunity that remains largely untapped

items.title: Organisers call for sixth night of protest as Morocco death toll rises to three
bullets: • The death toll in the protests has risen to three, local authorities said
• Two people were killed in the southern city of Lqlia on Wednesday night after security forces opened fire at protesters
• The deaths were the first fatalities as anger mounts across the north African country

items.title: The Energy Department canceled billions in funding. Democrats say it's retribution
bullets: • Department of Energy cancels more than $7 billion in funding for 223 projects
• The White House Office of Management and Budget Director Russ Vought said the funding was for projects in 16 states
• Vought posted on social media site X that the projects were in 16 of which voted for former Vice President Kamala Harris

items.title: ‘We are the last hope’: Gen Z Madagascar vows to fight on until president resigns
bullets: • The unrest broke out on 25 September when local councillors were arrested for protesting against water and electricity outages in the capital, Antananarivo
• The youth-led protests quickly spread to other towns and cities, fuelled by social media and other “Gen Z protests in Indonesia and Nepal, where the government was toppled

items.title: Hamas military leader in Gaza objects to ceasefire plan, BBC understands
bullets: • Hamas military leader in Gaza objects to ceasefire plan, BBC understands
• Head of Hamas's military wing in Gaza has indicated he does not agree to the new US ceasefire plan
• US President Donald Trump's 20-point framework to end the war stipulates that Hamas disarm and have no role in governing Gaza

items.title: White House says layoffs 'imminent' with no end to shutdown in sight
bullets: • White House says mass layoffs of federal workers are 'imminent' with no end to shutdown in sight
• Government shutdown began on Wednesday, after Republicans and Democrats failed to agree a new spending plan
• The next vote to try and end the situation will not be held until Friday

items.title: What's behind the health care fight that led to the government shutdown
bullets: • At issue is the cost of premiums for health care plans people buy on Obamacare marketplaces
• The enhanced tax credits are important for people who don't get health insurance through their job or a public program like Medicare or Medicaid
• This year enrollment hit a record 24 million

items.title: What Extreme Heat Is Doing to Your Body
bullets: • Heat is the No
• 1 weather-related cause of death worldwide and in the U.S
• Heat has a bearing on nearly every aspect of human health, from skin down to DNA
• Long-term exposure to high temperatures is causing cumulative harm to our bodies and minds

items.title: A century-old piano mystery has just been solved
bullets: • Scientists confirm that pianists can alter timbre through touch, using advanced sensors to capture micro-movements that shape sound perception
• The discovery bridges art and science, promising applications in music, neuroscience, and beyond
• The results revealed that listeners could distinguish the pianists' intended timbres, regardless of whether or not they had any piano performance training experience

items.title: How gaslighting tricks the brain into questioning reality
bullets: • McGill University researchers reframed gaslighting as a learning process rooted in how our brains handle prediction and surprise
• The new model highlights how trust and close relationships can be exploited by manipulators who repeatedly undermine a person’s confidence in their own reality

items.title: Life after: being on death row
bullets: • Anthony Ray Hinton spent nearly 30 years on Alabama's death row
• He was wrongly convicted of two murders and sentenced to death in 1985
• Hinton was saddled with an incompetent public defender
• He now dedicates his time to preventing others experiencing the same fate

items.title: Coming to Wicked Horror TV in October
bullets: • The original, the classic Halloween (1978) and much more is coming to Wicked Horror TV in October
• Watch out for walking dead girls, a dybbuk box, cars with teeth and a mystery only Boris Karloff can solve
• You’ll get the best of classic horror, recent indy masterpieces, trashing cult flicks and even more

items.title: Meet the woman steering Biden's bipartisan winning streak on Capitol Hill
bullets: • The White House has a long list of issues facing the nation's first two years of Congress
• President Barack Obama and his staff are working on a bipartisan agenda
• They say it's important to keep the public eye on what's happening in the U.S

items.title: How Kyrsten Sinema's decision makes Democrats' 2024 Senate map tighter
bullets: • Arizona Sen
• Kyrsten Sinema has always been a thorn in the Democrats side during her time in Congress
• She voted against her party more than almost any other member of Congress
• Now, the Democratic caucus has 48 Democrats and three independents

items.title: TVC15: Jar Jar Binks (VC108)
bullets: • Hasbro produced a version of Jar Jar Binks for their Movie Heroes kids’ line
• Unfortunately, the Movie Heroes version supersedes the one from The Vintage Collection
• Perhaps a stellar repainting is all this figure needs, but it doesn’t meet our standards in its current state

items.title: Trump administration spending $625m to revive dying coal industry
bullets: • The White House will open 13.1m acres (5.3m hectares) of public land to coal mining while providing $625m for coal-fired power plants
• Coal, the most polluting and costly fossil fuel, has been on a rapid decline over the past 30 years
• Wind and solar produced more electricity than coal in the US for the first time in history

items.title: TVC15: Mawhonic (Podracer Pilot) (VC71)
bullets: • Mawhonic (Podracer Pilot) entered into The Vintage Collection after a delay
• Expertly detailed and beautifully painted, the Gran was entered into the collection after a short delay
• The Phantom Menace is a 16.75-inch Super-Articulated Boonta Eve Classic Gran

items.title: RFR Q&A #265: The Posters of RETURN OF THE JEDI
items.outlet: All Shows - Rebel Force Radio: Star Wars Podcast
bullets: • RFR Q&A #265: The Posters of RETURN OF THE JEDI///
• The final film of the Original Trilogy was released with a slew of fresh and original poster artwork
• Peter Beisser conducts interviews with artists who worked on the iconic ROTJ "lightsaber" poster

items.title: RFR Q&A #266: Underappreciated Scenes from Star Wars
items.outlet: All Shows - Rebel Force Radio: Star Wars Podcast
bullets: • RFR Q&A #266: Underappreciated Scenes from Star Wars
• Dominique Garant explains why we need to pay a little more attention to some of the more subtle Star Wars moments
• The series of episodes is exclusively available to RFR INSIDER+ supporters and higher of RFR on Patreon

items.title: Artist Rachele Aragno talks Yuletide horror
bullets: • Rachele Aragno is known for her artwork on Leonid the Vampire and Star Wars: The High Republic
• She recently turned her attention to mythic characters and creatures for the holiday horror-fantasy adventure Yuletide
• The series focuses ancient creatures unleashed in the small town of Christmas, Pennsylvania

items.title: Redbox’s next product may be piracy lawsuits
bullets: • A company called Grove Street Partners has offered $100 million for so-called “IP Litigation Assets” owned by Chicken Soup for the Soul Entertainment and its subsidiaries
• The exact content of those assets wasn’t disclosed
• The assets include rights to pursue litigation for copyright infringement against third parties

items.title: Here’s how to get Xbox Game Pass Ultimate at the old price
bullets: • Microsoft recently announced price hikes for some tiers of Xbox Game Pass, including Ultimate and PC Game Pass
• The Ultimate tier, which offers the most games and features, went from $19.99 per month to $29.99
• You can get a one-month subscription to Game Pass Ultimate for $59.99 at Amazon, GameStop, Best Buy, or Walmart

items.title: Shein is opening its first physical stores
bullets: • Shein has announced plans to open its first physical locations in France this November
• The fast-fashion company will open locations across Dijon, Grenoble, Reims, Limoges, and Angers
• The move comes as the country works on legislation to regulate the fast fashion industry

items.title: Ring’s new Search Party feature is on by default; should you opt out?
bullets: • Ring, an Amazon-owned smart security company, announced a new feature to help find lost dogs
• When someone posts a picture of a lost dog on Ring’s Neighbors app, they will be able to initiate a Search Party
• Ring then uses AI to scan footage from nearby outdoor Ring cameras and doorbells for the lost pet

items.title: Google is destroying independent websites, and one sees no choice but to defend it anyway
bullets: • Google’s new ad-tech ad tools give it stability, even as other parts of the world are changing
• Users are clicking through to the ads less and clicking on them less, as a result of the new tools
• Google says it has no choice but to continue to use the tools to help people navigate the web

items.title: CNN Political Briefing
bullets: • CNN Political Director David Chalian takes you inside the latest developments with insight and analysis from the key players in politics
• Suzan DelBene (D-WA) is laser-focused on re-capturing the House in 2026
• The race for New Jersey governor could be the sleeper contest of the year

items.title: The Axe Files with David Axelrod
bullets: • The Axe Files with David Axelrod is a series of revealing interviews with key figures in the political world
• This week marks the final episode of the series of interviews with Axelrod's friend, US Ambassador to Japan Rahm Emanuel
• Scott Jennings is well known as a conservative firebrand on CNN

items.title: Margins of Error
bullets: • This season on Margins of Error, Harry teases out big ideas like what accents say about where we live, how much money it takes to be happy, and whether the U.S
• should finally switch to the metric system
• Harry talks to some very smart people who are doing their best to optimize the way we travel

items.title: The Numbers Business Report: 2026 Q2 Box Office Prediction
bullets: • The Numbers Business Report: 2026 Q2 Box Office Prediction
• New feature article provides our first full prediction, as well as movie-by-movie forecasts for the major releases scheduled for that period
• Several titles should feature titles earning over $100 million, primarily from established and successful franchises

items.title: Weekend projections: One Battle After Another and Gabby’s Dollhouse hoping for good word-of-mouth after middling debuts
bullets: • One Battle After Another will have the distinction of giving Paul Thomas Anderson his best weekend ever, besting the $4.9 million earned by There Will Be Blood during its run back in January 2008
• The new film will need exceptional legs to justify its higher production budget ($140 million vs
• $25 million for There Will be Blood), and marketing costs
• Gabby’s Dollhouse: The Movie will likewise need great word-of-mouth to become a hit

items.title: Weekend predictions: One Battle After Another will win the weekend
bullets: • One Battle After Another will mark the start of awards season with an opening that looks set to exceed $20 million
• That will ensure not only a best weekend for Anderson, but also his first chart-topper
• The closest he's come is There Will Be Blood, which picked up $4.87 million on its fifth weekend in release, back in January 2008
